Title: EU’s spot LNG key without tougher decarbonisation laws: ACER
Description: The European Union is set to deepen its reliance on spot LNG by 2030 without stronger decarbonisation goals, according to a new report from the Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER).
Author: JS

Title: FERC urged to expedite reapproval of Commonwealth LNG
Description: US Speaker of the House Mike Johnson and a Republican delegation from Congress have urged the expedited reauthorisation decision of the Commonwealth LNG project in Louisiana.
Author: JS

Title: Germany’s DET offers short-term regasification capacity at Wilhelmshaven 2, other terminals
Description: Germany’s federally owned LNG terminal operator, Deutsche Energy Terminal, is offering short-term regasification capacity for 2025 and 2026 at the Wilhelmshaven 2 terminal currently undergoing commissioning, and the existing Wilhelmshaven 1 and Brunsbuettel LNG receiving terminals. The capacity will  be auctioned on the Prisma European capacity platform between Jun. 23 and July 2.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Zhejiang Energy agrees 10-year deal with BP  for up to 1 mtpa of LNG
Description: China’s Zhejiang Energy has signed a long-term agreement with BP to purchase up to 1 mtpa of LNG over 10 years, building on the companies’ previous LNG collaboration.
Author: CK

Title: Freeport LNG gets regulatory approval to return third LNG storage tank to service
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has approved Freeport LNG’s request to return its third LNG storage tank and associated Phase 3 facilities to service, marking the final step in the 15 mtpa Texas-based terminal’s recovery from a June 2022 fire that led to an eight-month shutdown.
Author: CK

Title: Guangdong Pearl River Investment signs first long-term LNG deal with ConocoPhillips
Description: Chinese asset investment firm Guangdong Pearl River Investment has signed its first long-term LNG sales and purchase agreement, spanning 15 years, with US energy major ConocoPhillips, as it seeks to expand its role in the global gas value chain.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy targets first North Field East LNG train coming online mid next year
Description: QatarEnergy is aiming to bring the first liquefaction train of its North Field East LNG expansion project in Qatar online in mid-2026, with the remaining trains to follow thereafter.
Author: CK
